description: From Medieval Latin āctuātus, perfect passive participle of āctuō (“actuate, implement”), from Latin āctus, perfect passive participle of agō (“do, act”).

verbs.description: actuate (third-person singular simple present actuates, present participle actuating, simple past and past participle actuated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To activate, or to put into motion; to animate.
examples: Wings, which others were contriving to actuate by the perpetual motion.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To incite to action; to motivate.
examples: A man in a fit of anger, is actuated in a very different manner from one who only thinks of that emotion.
